description: The erection of a basement and 5 storey building (with roof level lift motor room and plant room) fronting Islington Green to provide basement car parking for 46 cars (1840sq.m. gross)  with access from Colebrooke Row retail space at ground floor (1000sq.m. gross)  and 1st- 4th floor B1 offices with ground floor reception area (2500sq.m. gross);the erection of a terrace of six 3 storey houses in the backland between the office building and the existing houses at 61-64 (consec) Duncan Terrace and the erection of one 3 storey terrace house abutting No.64 Duncan Terrace and fronting onto Colebrooke Row.The proposal involve the total demolition of the petrol filling station fronting onto Islington Green and of the vehicle parking and servicing building to its rear known as 85 Colebrooke Row.
decision: Called in by Secretary of State
decision_conditions: Had an appeal against Non-determination not been lodged, planning permission would have been refused for the same reasons as set out on report on application no. 88/0519. APPEAL DISMISSED 15.12.88.
